title: Usage
text: package aims implement simple way methodologies INE Chile ECLAC quality evaluation estimates household surveys. tutorial shows basic use package includes main functions create necessary inputs implement quality standards.

title: Usage
text: use two datasets: Encuesta Nacional de Empleo (efm 2020) VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares datasets loaded package can used package loaded session 1. data edition case ENE purpuse creating subpopulations (work force, unemployed unemployed).
code: library(survey) library(calidad) library(dplyr) ene <- ene %>%    mutate(fdt = if_else(cae_especifico >= 1 & cae_especifico <= 9, 1, 0), # labour force          ocupado = if_else(cae_especifico >= 1 & cae_especifico <= 7, 1, 0), # employed          desocupado = if_else(cae_especifico >= 8 & cae_especifico <= 9, 1, 0)) # unemployed  # One row per household epf <- epf_personas %>%    group_by(folio) %>%    slice(1) %>%    ungroup()

title: Usage
text: starting use package, necessary declare sample design survey, use survey package. primary sample unit, stratum weights must declared. also possible use design weights, nevertheless case variance estimated simple random sampling assumption. case declare complex design two surveys (EPF ENE). Additionally, may useful declare option strata one PSU.
code: # Store original options old_options <-  options() # Complex sample design for ENE dc_ene <- svydesign(ids = ~conglomerado , strata = ~estrato_unico, data = ene, weights = ~fact_cal) # Complex sample design for EPF dc_epf <- svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf, weights = ~fe) options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty")

title: Usage
text: assess quality estimate, INE methodology establishes differentiated criteria estimates proportion (ratio), one hand, estimates mean, size total, . case proportion estimation, necessary sample size, degrees freedom standard error. estimates require sample size, degrees freedom, coefficient variation. package includes separate functions create inputs estimates mean, proportion, totals size. following example shows proportion size functions used. var: variable estimated. Must dummy variable domains: required domains. subpop: reference subpopulation. optional works filter (must dummy variable) design: sample design function returns neccesary inputs implement standard get domains, can use “+” symbol follows: useful parameter eclac_input. allows return ECLAC inputs. default parameter FALSE option TRUE can activate .
code: insumos_prop <- create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) # proportion of unemployed people insumos_total <-  create_size(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) # number of unemployed people desagregar <- create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo+region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) eclac_inputs <-  create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo+region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene, eclac_input = TRUE)

title: Usage
text: cases may interest assess quality sum. example, sum income EPF geographical area level (Gran Santiago regional capitals). , create_total function. function receives continuous variable hours, expense, income generates totals requested level. ending “” function alludes fact continuous variable used. want evaluate estimate mean, function create_mean. case, calculate average expenditure households, according geographical area. default usage disaggregate, case functions used follows:
code: insumos_suma <-  create_total(var = "gastot_hd", domains = "zona", design =  dc_epf) insumos_media <-  create_mean(var = "gastot_hd", domains = "zona", design =  dc_epf) # ENE dataset insumos_prop_nacional <- create_prop("desocupado", subpop = "fdt", design = dc_ene) insumos_total_nacional <-  create_total("desocupado", subpop = "fdt", design = dc_ene) # EPF dataset insumos_suma_nacional <- create_total("gastot_hd", design = dc_epf) insumos_media_nacional <-  create_mean("gastot_hd", design = dc_epf)

title: Usage
text: inputs generated, can evaluation. , use evaluate function. output dataframe , addition containing information already generated, includes column indicates whether estimate unreliable, less reliable reliable. function evaluate parameter allows us know table published . Following criteria standard, 50% estimates table reliable, published.
code: evaluacion_prop <- evaluate(insumos_prop) evaluacion_tot <- evaluate(insumos_total) evaluacion_suma <- evaluate(insumos_suma) evaluacion_media <- evaluate(insumos_media) # Desempleo desagregado por region desagregar <- create_size(var = "desocupado", domains = "region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) # Evaluar tabulado evaluacion_tot_desagreg <- evaluate(desagregar, publicar = T) # Reset original options options(old_options)

what: Calcula el numero de estratos — calcular_estrato
title: Calcula el numero de estratos — calcular_estrato
text: Genera una tabla con el conteo de estratos para cada uno de los domains del tabulado. La columna que contiene la informacion de los estratos debe llamarse varstrat La funcion contempla un caso para proporcion y un caso para promedio

title: Calcula el numero de estratos — calcular_estrato
Calcula el numero de estratos — calcular_estrato

title: Calcula el numero de estratos — calcular_estrato

Calcula los grados de libertad para un estimaciones de total — calcular_gl_total

title: Calculates multiple estimations. Internal wrapper for survey package — calcular_tabla
text: var variable objetivo dentro de un dataframe. Debe anteponerse ~ domains domains de estimacion separados por signo +. Debe anteponerse ~ disenio disenio complejo creado mediante el paquete survey estimation string indicating mean must calculated env environment toma el ambiente de la funcion contenedora, para usar los elementos requeridos fun Function required regarding estimation denom denominator. parameter works ratio estimation

title: Calculates multiple estimations. Internal wrapper for survey package — calcular_tabla
text: dataframe que contiene variables de agregacion, variable objetivo y error estandar

title: Genera table en html con los resultados de la evaluación — create_html
code: library(survey) #> Loading required package: grid #> Loading required package: Matrix #> Loading required package: survival #>  #> Attaching package: 'survey' #> The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': #>  #>     dotchart library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  hogar <- epf_personas %>%   group_by(folio) %>%   slice(1) dc <- survey::svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = hogar, weights = ~fe) table <- evaluate(create_prop("ocupado", domains = "zona+sexo", design = dc))

what: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: create_mean generates dataframe following elements: mean, degrees freedom, sample size coefficient variation. function allows grouping several domains.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
code: create_mean(   var,   domains = NULL,   subpop = NULL,   design,   ci = FALSE,   ess = FALSE,   ajuste_ene = FALSE,   standard_eval = FALSE,   rm.na = FALSE,   deff = FALSE,   rel_error = FALSE,   unweighted = FALSE,   eclac_input = FALSE )

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: var numeric variable within  dataframe. domains domains estimated separated + character. subpop integer dummy variable filter dataframe design complex design created survey package ci boolean indicating confidence intervals must calculated ess boolean Effective sample size ajuste_ene boolean indicating adjustment sampling-frame transition period must used standard_eval boolean Indicating function wrapped inside function, TRUE avoid lazy eval errors rm.na boolean Remove NA required deff boolean Design effect rel_error boolean Relative error unweighted boolean Add non weighted count required eclac_input boolean return eclac inputs

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: dataframe contains inputs domains evaluated

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean

text: create_prop generates dataframe following elements: sum, degrees freedom, sample size, standard error coefficient variation. function allows grouping several domains.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
code: create_prop(   var,   denominador = NULL,   domains = NULL,   subpop = NULL,   design,   ci = FALSE,   deff = FALSE,   ess = FALSE,   ajuste_ene = FALSE,   rel_error = FALSE,   log_cv = FALSE,   unweighted = FALSE,   standard_eval = FALSE,   eclac_input = FALSE )

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
text: var numeric variable within dataframe, numerator ratio calculated. denominador numeric variable within dataframe, denominator ratio calculated. var parameter dummy, can NULL domains domains estimated separated + character. subpop integer dummy variable filter dataframe design complex design created survey package ci boolean indicating confidence intervals must calculated deff boolean Design effect ess boolean Effective sample size ajuste_ene boolean indicating adjustment sampling-frame transition period must used rel_error boolean Relative error log_cv boolean logarithmic coefficient variation unweighted boolean Add non weighted count required standard_eval boolean Indicating function wrapped inside function, TRUE avoid lazy eval errors eclac_input boolean return eclac inputs

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
text: dataframe contains inputs domains evaluated

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
code: library(survey) library(dplyr)  epf <- mutate(epf_personas, gasto_zona1 = if_else(zona == 1, gastot_hd, 0)) dc <- svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf, weights = ~fe) old_options <- options() options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty")  create_prop(var = "gasto_zona1", denominador = "gastot_hd", design =  dc) #>   gastot_hd  gastot_hd.1  df     n         cv #> 1 0.6138541 0.0006176149 248 48308 0.04048496  enusc <- filter(enusc, Kish == 1)  dc <- svydesign(ids = ~Conglomerado, strata = ~VarStrat, data = enusc, weights = ~Fact_Pers) options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty") create_prop(var = "VP_DC", denominador = "hom_insg_taxi", design = dc) #>   hom_insg_taxi hom_insg_taxi.1  df     n         cv #> 1     0.8937474     0.001906244 486 24465 0.04885111 options(old_options)

title: Encuesta Nacional Urbana de Seguridad ciudadana 2019 - ENUSC 2019 — enusc
Encuesta Nacional Urbana de Seguridad ciudadana 2019 - ENUSC 2019 — enusc
text: dataframe compuesto por 24.465 observaciones y 22 variables rph_sexo sexo: 1 = hombre; 2 = mujer region 16 regiones del país Fact_Pers factor de expansión para personas Fact_Hog factor de expansión para hogares Conglomerado unidad de primera etapa VarStrat estrato VP_DC victimización Personas, utiliza Fact_Pers VA_DC victimización Agregada Hogares, utiliza Fact_Hog rph_edad edad del entrevistado P3_1_1 Percepción aumento de la delincuencia en el país, utiliza Fact_Pers P8_1_1 Causa aumento delincuencia en el barrio, utiliza Fact_Pers muj_insg_taxi Percepción inseguridad en taxis de mujeres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers hom_insg_taxi Percepción inseguridad en taxis de hombres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers muj_insg_micro Percepción inseguridad en microbuses de mujeres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers hom_insg_micro Percepción inseguridad en microbuses de hombres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers muj_insg_centr.com Percepción inseguridad en centros comerciales de mujeres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers hom_insg_centr.com Percepción inseguridad en centros comerciales de hombres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers muj_insg_loc.col Percepción inseguridad en locomoción colectiva de mujeres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers hom_insg_loc.col Percepción inseguridad en locomoción colectiva de hombres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers muj_insg_barrio Percepción inseguridad en el barrio de mujeres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers hom_insg_barrio Percepción inseguridad en el barrio de hombres, variable elaborada con varaibles P9 y sexo, utiliza Fact_Pers

what: VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas
title: VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas
text: Versión reducida de la base de datos de la VIII EPF. Contiene algunas variables sociodemográficas y la información necesaria para trabajar con el diseño complejo.

title: VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas
VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas
text: dataframe compuesto por 48.308 observaciones y 8 variables sexo sexo: 1 = hombre; 2 = mujer zona área de estimación: 1 = región metropolitana; 2 = resto de capitales regionales ecivil estado civil fe factor de expansión varunit unidad de primera etapa varstrat estrato gastot_hd gasto promedio por hogar ocupado indica de la persona está ocupada o : 1 = ocupado; 0 = ocupado

title: VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas
text: https://www.ine.cl/estadisticas/sociales/ingresos-y-gastos/encuesta-de-presupuestos-familiares

title: VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares — epf_personas

what: Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
title: Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
text: evaluate evauates quality mean estimation using methodology created INE Chile, considers sample size, degrees freedom coeficient variation.

title: Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
text: table dataframe created crear_insumos_media publish boolean indicating evaluation complete table must added. TRUE, function adds new column dataframe scheme string variable, default scheme "chile" refers evaluation protocol proposed INE Chile. alternative "cepal" use CEPAL protocol ... list cepal parameters. complete list parameters 1. General Parameters df degrees freedom. default: 9 n sample size. default ine scheme 60. default cepal scheme: 100 2. INE parameters cv_lower_ine lower limit cv. default: 0.15 cv_upper_ine upper limit cv. default: 0.3 3. CEPAL parameters cv_cepal limit cv. default: 0.2 ess efective sample size. default: 140 unweighted unweighted count. default: 50

title: Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
text: dataframe columns included input table, plus new column containing label indicating evaluation estimation: reliable, bit reliable unreliable

title: Evaluate the quality of mean estimations — evaluate
code: dc <- survey::svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf_personas, weights = ~fe) evaluate(create_mean("gastot_hd", domains = "zona+sexo", design = dc)) #>   zona sexo    stat       se  df     n         cv                 eval_n #> 1    1    1 1378016 69421.07 127 12300 0.05037756 sufficient sample size #> 2    2    1 1082227 36324.22 121 10393 0.03356434 sufficient sample size #> 3    1    2 1325015 68510.58 127 13729 0.05170551 sufficient sample size #> 4    2    2 1088658 35343.76 121 11886 0.03246545 sufficient sample size #>         eval_df    eval_cv  label #> 1 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 fiable #> 2 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 fiable #> 3 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 fiable #> 4 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 fiable

Genera intervalos de confianza para todos los domains estimados — get_ci

title: Genera intervalos de confianza para todos los domains estimados — get_ci
text: dataframe que contiene todos los elementos del estandar, junto tres columnas nuevas que contienen el limite inferior, el limite superior y el valor t

title: Calcula tamanio muestral para las medias — get_sample_size
